meanings.definition: Encourage or stir up (violent or unlawful behavior)
meanings.sent1: The angry mob was incited by the false rumors.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech incites violence among the supporters.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous prankster incites chaos wherever he goes.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior incites trouble like a spark ignites a fire.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise incites fear in the timid cat.

meanings.sent1: The bully tried to incite a fight during recess.
meanings.sent2: The coach incites the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel incites the dog to chase it up the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her teasing remarks incite laughter among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The tempting aroma of freshly baked cookies incites cravings in everyone.

meanings.definition: Stimulate or prompt (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The challenging puzzle incites her to think creatively.
meanings.sent2: The inspiring movie incites viewers to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of popcorn incites moviegoers to buy some.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker's words incite action in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful artwork incites admiration and awe in the visitors.
